Rellian holds a shotgun, bright orange cords running from stock to the central console of this Marksman ST-2 Indoor Shooting Simulator. On the screen, a grouse flies up and Rellian fires.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay. Rell. Get your things.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: One second there. Rellian doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Rell, come on.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I said, one second. Ben ignores Jack and speaks directly to Rellian.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Rell, look at me. I understand that you're angry for making us go to the church with us dressed like that. And I apologize. But sometimes you have to do things that you - (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GREEN, (9.2.2014)
dialogues.text: Jack turns on the lights. Ben pauses.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Rellian has something to say.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: - that you don't want to do, that you do because it's what someone -

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: You killed Mom!

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I heard you. I heard you fighting about where we live! Mom wanted to leave! I heard.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Mom and I made certain decisions about how -

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: You're the worst dad in the whole world! I want to live here, with Nana and Grandpa! Rell is so angry that his face is turning red.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Well, that's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I hate you! I fucking hate you! 98 Rellian bolts out of the room, followed by Abigail, leavi Ben and Jack alone. Ben turns, calling after Rell.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Come back here right now! Not five feet from Ben's head, an arrow THUDS into the wa Ben jumps. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stares at the arrow, buried deep in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck. He turns to see Jack lower Rellian's bow.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That almost hit me. Jack examines the bow, then points to the various mounted game around the room.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If I had wanted to hit you, I would have hit you. Jack pours himself a drink, but doesn't offer one to Ben.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isolated from the world. No friends their own age. It will have a profoundly deleterious impact on them. For the rest of their lives.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You just shot a fucking arrow at me! Jack sips his drink.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You told us that they were in school.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Leslie and I are their teachers. Were. Their teachers.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You teach them to steal?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: "Mission: Free the Food."

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That was part of their training.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So you're "training" them to steal. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben pauses. GREEN (9.2.2014) 84. 98

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Their mother just died. They were in shock. They were devastated. They needed something to distract them. It was for Noam Chomsky Day.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Noam Chomsky Day. Right. That's when you gave the children real weapons.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Tell Rell that we're going. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How did he break his hand?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He fell. And it's not broken.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Climbing a rock face. In the rain.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It was an accident. And it wasn’t raining.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He has bruises all over his body.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: They're scratches. It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's child abuse. Even if they make it through whatever it is you're doing to them, they'll be completely unable to survive as adults, totally unprepared for the real world.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: And I think the opposite is true. Are you going to get him or do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Rellian is legally old enough to choose. Perhaps you didn't know that. But I intend to honor his wishes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack hands Ben a business card. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My lawyer's card. Abby and I have decided to file for the custody of the children. I know you don't have a phone. But I strongly suggest you call him immediately so we're not forced to issue a warrant for your arrest. Ben rips the card in half.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He is my son. I'm not leaving without him. Jack picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Who's this, please? (pause) Hello, Bill. It's Jack Bertrang, up in Coronado. Listen, I think I just saw someone prowling around outside the house. Could you send a car over right away? (pause) Thank you very much. Jack replaces the phone and stares at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd care to explain Rellian's injuries to the police. I'm not sure I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben starts the bus and peels it out of the gravel parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: Where's Rell?

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: Why are we leaving without Rell? Ben says nothing, barreling down the driveway.  100 101 GREEN (9.2.2014) 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, Ben and the kids, lie in the brush, surveilling their grandparent's home. Ben - looking through binoculars - watches as Jack shakes hands with a POLICE OFFICER in the driveway. The officer in his squad car, drives down the gravel driveway, and disappears. Ben passes the binoculars to Vespyr.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Prisoner located. Second floor. Middle window over the garage. Vespyr peers through the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: Target locked.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Mission is a go. Bo slaps Vesp on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: Don't fall.

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: You'll fracture your cranium. Or the impact will cause an acute subdural hematoma. Or your vertebra could pop out off your back in an axial compression fracture —-

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Zaj.

dialogues.speaker: KIELYR
dialogues.text: Bring him home, Vesp. Vespyr jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vespyr stares at a dark wall of Jack and Abigail's house. It's about a twenty foot climb straight up to the roof. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She bolts - full speed - toward the wall. She plants a foot on a water spout, grabs a tree branch, in one swift motion - swings herself up to the lip and fl onto the roof. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She kneels in the dark, scanning. Planning. Like a trapeze artist, nimble and moving swiftly, Vespyr shimmies across a long, narrow section of the roof. She leaps, landing in a crouch on a flat section of the r and pauses, again analyzing her trajectory. She pounces, gripping a drain pipe and flings herself upw It's steep, it's slow going, but she's strong. Now at the very top of the house, fifty feet off the grou she shuffles over a cupola and drops onto another section the roof. She hovers over a second story window, the light on, now 5 feet away. She turns and gripping a tile, she lowers herself. CRACK. The tile snaps and - in an instant - Vespyr tumbles down roof. She bumps and somersaults, head over heels, her hands grasping at the roof as she falls, but there's nothing to hold. And she flips over the edge... Dropping twenty feet... Until her body slams - with a sickening thud - against an parked in the gravel driveway. She rolls off, a rag doll, flops to the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Vesp! Everyone leaps up and races to her. The lights of the parking perimeter FLASH on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back of an ambulance, Ben kneels next to Vespyr, w lies on a gurney. Her eyes are closed and an oxygen mask is on her face. An EMT PARAMEDIC monitors her vitals.  103 104 105 106 GREEN (9.2.2014) 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben runs, helpless, next to the EMTs as they race Vespyr the gurney down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben paces the hallways. The kids sleep on hallway benches and on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the middle of the night. The corridor is now dimly l and empty. Ben sits against a wall on the floor. A DOCTOR comes out of Vespyr's room and Ben leaps up to m him.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: She has a decent concussion. But we did a CAT scan and there's absolutely no damage to the brain. A simple fracture across the tibia and fibula on her left leg. She'll need a neck- brace and a cast. But she's fine. Ben can't help but cry, but he's doing everything he can pretend like he's not.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd like to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor clicks on a light on a wall-mounted light box illuminates an X-Ray. He touches it.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Top vertebrae. That slight discoloration? That's a bruise. What was she doing on a roof?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Just... playing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Exactly how far did she fall? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Twenty feet or so. Ben leans in. An infinitesimal gray line, about the width a hair and no longer than a finger nail, is barely perceptible across the top vertebrae.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: She a gymnast? Ben shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But she plays a lot of sports. Ben shakes his head no again.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hmm. For a girl her age, she's unusually strong. Physically. It's... remarkable. The doctor points to the bruise on the X-ray.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have seven vertebrae in the neck. A break in any of the first four, a tear to the spinal cord, I'm talking even a millimeter more than what happened here - a millimeter. Your daughter would be dead. You are a very lucky man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark room, Ben sits next to a sleeping Vespyr, hol her hand. He watches the EKG monitor. Watches as her hear beat bounces up and down, up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack holds open the front door - Abigail helps Vespyr, on crutches and in a neck-brace, into the foyer. They are followed in by the rest of the kids. And then finally, by Ben, carrying luggage. Omitted 109  110 111 112 GREEN (9.2.2014) 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the massive grass lawn in the back of their grandparen house, Ben watches as his kids run Jack through a serious full-body, hardcore functional training routine: they’re shouting orders at him, teaching him how to move from lun to Burpies into Plank.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why is this called a Burpie? Am I supposed to burp? Nai finds this hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: NAI
dialogues.text: No! Because it makes you want to vomit! If you do them enough.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: No burping!

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: No stopping!

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR KIELYR
dialogues.text: No vomiting allowed! No throwing up! All the kids are laughing; everyone is having a great tim with their grandfather. Abigail appears in front of Ben, blocking his view.  113 GREEN (9.2.2014) 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The enormous garage is filled with all kinds of athletic equipment and ephemera: his-and-her bicycles, golf trophi golf carts. Abigail is on the floor of the garage, fishing around in cardboard box. She passes a photograph to Ben. It is a photograph of Leslie at her High School Prom. She a bleached blonde streak in her hair, frosted eyeliner, a both her dress and her date's tuxedo are the height of 19 fashion.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: That boy, what was his name? Dean? Derek?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Dirk. Dirk Modzelewski.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Lord, you're right. He was as dumb as paint. Cute, though. I think she was just with him for the sex. Ben looks at Abigail, not sure whether or not to laugh. Abigail smiles and they both crack up.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's all kinds of stuff in here. Take what you want. Ben reaches into the box and pulls out another photograph This one is of Leslie at her Law School Graduation.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And there's also this. Abigail passes over a handwritten letter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right before you called about getting her treatment, she sent me two letters. No return address. I wanted you to see. Read here. Abigail passes over another letter and points to a paragr

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (reading) "You don't need to come get me anymore. Burn the other letter. What Ben and I have created here may be unique in all of human existence. We've created a paradise out of Plato's Republic. Our children shall be Philosopher Kings. It makes me so indescribably happy. I'm going to get better out here. I know I will. Because we are defined by our actions, not our words." Ben stares at the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks into a media screening room. All the children a watching television on a huge screen. Ben stares at his kids for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Remember the night when we slept on the glacier. The full moon. Bright like it was daytime. Mom made rabbit stew. With the wild ramps that Zaj collected. Rell turns up the volume on the television. Ben speaks ov it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was the spring when we found those black bear cubs. Someone shot their mother. And Mom wanted to keep them. But we let them go. Rell turns the volume up again. It's now blaring.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We gave you that. At least. Ben nods. And he then leaves the room.  115 116 GREEN (9.2.2014) 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Abigail sit on a sofa in their living room, righ outside of Jack’s office. Jack kisses Abigail's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids sit in a circle on the lawn, staring at Ben. The look stunned.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Like forever?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Nothing's forever.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: But like, not going home.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yes. Like not going home.

dialogues.speaker: KIELYR
dialogues.text: Dad.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: You don't love us anymore?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Of course I love you.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Then why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: BECAUSE I love you. The kids try to comprehend what they've just been told.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: But we want to live with you. Ben stares at his children. The moment stretches.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I almost got you killed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: The tile just popped out. Ben shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: Fine. Then explain. Explain.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Use your words. Ben smiles. Wrestling with his guilt and culpability rend Ben mute for perhaps the first time in his life. He tries articulate his thoughts. He fails.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: Dad. Ben looks up at Bo. He looks so lost.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: You okay? Ben stares. Almost like he's talking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Mom was so sick. I knew it. I did. I knew. I should have.... He doesn't finish his sentence.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: Mom was chemically imbalanced.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I thought. It would help her. I really thought she'd get better there.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It was too much. Living in the woods. For that long. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: I don't want to live here.

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: This house is a vulgar display of wealth.

dialogues.speaker: KIELYR
dialogues.text: And an unethical use of space.

dialogues.speaker: NAI
dialogues.text: Why can't we just stay with you? Ben focuses on his kids.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: If you do. I'm going to get one of you killed.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: This can't be the only choice. Dad. Dad? Ben is silent.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Dad! Ben doesn't seem to hear them. His eyes are dead. He look old, suddenly. The kids look at each other, unsure how to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben ambles, disorientated, into the hallway. Abigail stands as soon as she sees him. Ben appears suspended, just sort of shuffling in place; h has no idea where to go next. Abigail rushes over and pulls him into a hug. She pats th back of his head, soothing him like he's a child. Jack doesn't move. He stares down at the floor, giving th some space, trying to be as respectful as possible.  118 GREEN (9.2.2014) 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark and Rellian, in his pajamas, a shotgun i his hands, stands next to Jack. On the wall in front of t is another projected outdoor scene: four ducks fly over a pond. Rellian fires and hits two ducks. Immediately after he fi analysis appears on the screen: hit position, gun swing, changing flight velocity, entry of target trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look at that! We'll make a marksman of you yet.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: I got two! Rellian beams.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: See how when you stop your swing, you're no longer on the target? Okay, hold on. Jack presses a button on the console and now the simulato shows the replay in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good entry point on the trajectory. But right there. Can you tell me why you missed? Rellian reads the display.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: Looks like I was slow maybe?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Correct, it's timing, but see there? Says your swing path was off. Next time... Jack adjusts Rellian's barrel.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next time come in on a path more like that. Okay. Ready? Rellian smiles and nods as Jack hits a button on the cons (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: When are we going to move my mom's body?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Move it where?

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: I mean, so she can be cremated.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh. We're not doing that. This confuses Rell.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: No. But it was in her Will.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I understand. But we're not burning her body. Pay attention now. Rell drops his barrel, suddenly so agitated that the volu of his voice betrays him.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: Grandpa? We have to cremate her! She had really specific instructions. About what she wanted.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Your mother had no idea what she wanted. Watch the screen. You just missed the first round. Rellian's face flushes red.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: No! It was super important to her! She wanted music and -

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Do not raise your voice to me, young man. Rell stares at his grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: Can we please have a discourse? Jack smiles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This is not up for discussion.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: Don't I at least get my chance to argue my -

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm a grown-up. You're a child. I make decisions that you won't understand. One day you will. No one said it's fair. That is life. It's a vital lesson, worth learning right now. It's waste a time to fight it. You will not win. Is that understood? Rell continues to stare at Jack. Then he nods. Jack musses up Rellian's hair.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good boy. I'm getting some ice cream, you want some ice cream? We have Cherry Garcia and coffee, if Nana didn't polish it off. Jack flips the light on and ambles toward the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is unpacking Steve, piling some of the kid's things o the gravel driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo closes the door to the game room.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: Okay. We're safe. He nods at Zaja. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rell marches GREEN (9.2.2014) 99. 121

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: The "Widowhood Effect." And here, from an article I read in The Economist or The Lancet, I can’t remember which, but I'm quoting a recent study by The Harvard School of Public Health: in a long-term relationship or marriage, after the death of a partner, men are 18% more likely to die. Additionally, more recent studies indicate that there's a 66% increased chance of dying during the first 3 months and in men under 59, standardized mortality rates were about 90 times the average in the FIRST WEEK.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: I'm leaving. toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: "Mission: Rescue Dad and Mom." First objective. We provide Dad with a clear goal and legitimate closure. Secondary objective. We rescue Mom's body. Rell turns to look at his brothers and sisters.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: Fuck Nana and Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben stacks a pile of the kid's clothes in Jack's office.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You know where you headed? Ben shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How will I contact you?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I'll call you in a couple of days. I still need to ship you all their stuff. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On Jack's desk is a framed picture of Leslie. The same on that Ben keeps above the dashboard on Steve. It catches Ben’s eye. He stares at it. Jack follows his gaze. Both men stare at the photo for a moment. They look at each other. Leslie’s father, Leslie’s husban Neither sure how to acknowledge their profound mutual lov for her. They just nod. Finally, Jack extends his hand and they shake.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Zaja likes to collect things. Dead things. She's kind of an amateur taxidermist.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Nai doesn't like to wear clothes. Jack nods.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vespyr and Kielyr like to speak in Esperanto.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Bo wants to go to college. He got in everywhere. I don't know how we can afford it exactly, but -

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ben. I'll take of it. We'll take good care of them. There's nothing to worry about. I promise. You're doing the right thing. Ben nods his head.  123 124 125

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks across the gravel to Steve. EXT./INT. STEVE - STOPPED. DAY. He climbs up and closes the doors. He looks around. Without the kids, the bus is so empty. EXT. GRANDPARENT'S HOUSE. DAY. He pulls Steve out of the gravel parking lot. 100. 123 124 125  126 127 128 129 130 GREEN (9.2.2014) 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now on the highway, far from civilization, Ben bursts int tears. All the pain, the grief, the intense sadness of Leslie's death and from leaving his children - it all fin just pours out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a roadside gas station convenience store, Ben stacks bottles of water on the counter. Behind the ATTENDANT, something on the wall of items for catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dingy gas station bathroom, Ben stands in front of broken mirror, a newly bought hair clipper in his hand. He slowly, methodically, buzzes off his beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun sets, Steve is now but a small dot moving slow through the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the highway, in front of the parked bus, Ben stares i a small fire, shadows flitting across this face.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You shaved your face. Ben looks up to see Rellian standing not 5 feet away.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't hate you. For a second, Ben's not sure whether or not he's hallucinating.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wish you'd helped Mom. Then Ben sees the rest of his kids. Bo, Vespyr, Kielyr, Z and a completely naked Nai walk down off the bus. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GREEN, (9.2.2014)
dialogues.text: 130 Rellian hugs his dad.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: We want to complete the mission.

dialogues.speaker: KIELYR
dialogues.text: We want to save Mom.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: There is no mission.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: "Mission: Rescue Mommy."

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: Mom wanted to be cremated.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: We want to honor her wishes.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: And flush her down the toilet. Ben looks up at his kids. Ben smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I'm not ever going to put you in danger again.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: "If you assume that there is no hope, you guarantee that there will be no hope. If you assume that there is an instinct for freedom, that there are opportunities to change things, then there is a possibility that you can contribute to making a better world."

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Noam Chomsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve pulls into a dark cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family exits Steve and searches, silently, through th dark cemetery. They all carry flashlights and lanterns, casting long shadows, creeping across a moon-lit landscap

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: Dad! They all move toward Vespyr’s voice, gathering around a freshly covered grave. Zaja reads the gravestone.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: "Leslie Abigail Cash. April 23, 1967 - July 15, 2014. May God Bless her Soul for All Eternity." Nai unzips the duffel bag, revealing spades, garden trowe climbing rope.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Otherwise she has to lie under that bullshit forever. Ben and the kids thrust shovels into the freshly laid gra patches above the grave and dig.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - Nai and Zaja stand in the grave, shoveling dirt. - Climbing rope tied to the side handles of the casket, h by Bo and Rellian, Ben yanks the casket from the grave an slides it onto the grass. - The family, now covered in dirt, pauses, catching their breath, staring at the freshly dug casket.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: Mommy's in here. For a moment, they all forget where they are and what the doing. And touch the casket, imagining their mother insid  GREEN (9.2.2014) 103A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling through the parking lot under its weight - sil pallbearers - they carry their mother's casket to the bus  135 136 137 138 139 140 GREEN (9.2.2014) 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve pulls out of the cemetery parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve drives through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is awake as the bus travels down the freeway. All the children surround the open casket, resting in the center of the bus, and stare at - Leslie’s lifeless face, so white it’s almost translucent. They place flowers in her hair, on her chest, around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the small bathroom on the bus, Bo switches on the clipper. He slowly runs it across his scalp, lopping off long hair. He stares at himself in the mirror, his head now buzzed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo comes out of the bathroom. The kids look at their brother, but say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben drives through the night. He looks in the rearview mirror. All the kids, apart from Bo, are now finally asle Bo and Ben look at each other. Ben rubs his chin. No hair. Bo rubs the top of this head. No hair. Bo smiles at his dad and Ben smiles back.  141 GREEN (9.2.2014) 104A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is parked on a cliff overlooking the Pacific Ocean dawn breaks over the horizon. This early, the sky is an electric blue; the clouds, striations of yellow and orang (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leslie's body, tightly wrapped in a clean white sheet, li on top of about a cord of dry firewood and newspaper, creating a massive funeral pyre. Ben nods at Nai. As each kid approaches the pyre, they place a memento on their mother’s body: notes, flowers, etc.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Mommy. I love you. I love your hair. I love your smell. I love your face. I love your belly button. I love your sparkly shirt. I love how you cook. I think... that's about it. Ben nods at Zaja.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: You will always be my mommy. And I will never forget you and I will remember you every second of every day of my life. And when you burn up, only calcium, potassium, magnesium and trace element compounds will remain. And as your ashes mix with water and decomposing plants, you will be carbonates and oxides. You will be liming agents, raising pH, and neutralize acid in the earth and you'll make the soil happy. So things can grow. And I love you forever. Ben nods at Vespyr and Kielyr. They step forward, reading from a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: KIELYR
dialogues.text: "I think again over my small adventures. My fears. Those small ones that seemed so big. For all the vital things. I had to get and reach.”

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: “And yet there is only one great thing. The only thing. To live to see the great day that dawns. And the light that fills the world." Ben gestures and Bo steps forward. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: I had you as my mom. For 18 years. I hope you're happy now. I hope you're laughing. We're going to be okay. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As a family. Everything's going to be okay. Oh. And I sort of got into a bunch of colleges. Ben steps forward. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hey, Slug. It's me. I'm sorry. That I didn't know what to do. I'm sorry if I made things worse. You're my best friend. Ben smiles at Rellian. Rellian lights a wooden match and passes lit matches to t kids. Together, all the children reach up and light the p The newspaper and kindling catches, pops and crackles, engulfing Leslie's body in flames.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: This was Mom's favorite song. Rellian nods at Kielyr, who sings “Sweet Child of Mine,” Guns ‘N Roses. After the first verse, Bo joins on guitar, then Rell, on cajon, then Vespyr harmonizes, then Zaja plays her tambou and Nai comes in with his harmonica. As the music builds - black smoke billows above them all and now everyone, including Ben, is dancing and rocking o singing and crying and laughing. And it's a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and the kids ride the people-movers down the terminal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire family - Ben, Bo, Rellian, Vespyr and Kielyr, Zaja, and Nai - are crowded into a small toilet stall. Ben pulls a paper bag out of his backpack. He opens it wi enough for the ashes inside to be visible. Then he pours. They all stare at Leslie's ashes in the toilet bowl. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: There is a moment of silence. And then, they all just start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Bye, Mommy. And Nai flushes the toilet. INT. SEATTLE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT. DAY. At the ticket gate, all the kids hug Bo. Bo shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Why are you going to the Philippines?

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: I just put my finger on a map.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: The Moro Islamic Liberation Front kidnapped an American last year.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: "Cause if they kidnap you... She looks at Ben and then stops.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Say it. You know you want to.

dialogues.speaker: ZAJA
dialogues.text: If they kidnap you, you could die.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: Then I better watch out for them. Ben hugs his son tightly.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: When you have sex with a woman, be gentle and listen to her. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 143 144 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Treat her with respect and dignity, even if you don't love her.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Always tell the truth. And always take the high road.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Live each day like it could be your last. You drink it in, be adventurous, be bold, but savor it - it goes fast.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: I know. Ben stares at his son.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Don't die.

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN
dialogues.text: I won't. Ben nods. Then he and the kids walk away. After a moment, Nai runs back and hugs his brother's knee

dialogues.speaker: BODEVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Power to the people.

dialogues.speaker: NAIL
dialogues.text: Stick it to the man. Nai runs back and joins his family on the people-mover. 145 EXT. GAS STATION CONVENIENCE STORE. WASHINGTON. DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a roadside gas station payphone, Rellian speaks to Jac who sits in his home office.

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: It's what I want. It's what we all want. Swear you won't try to stop him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I won't stop him. Rell nods.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put your dad on the phone, will you? 145 Rellian holds out the phone for Ben, just now coming out the store, and Ben takes the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can ever forgive you for what you have done with Leslie. Ben nods.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Having said that. I promised to honor Rellian's wishes. And I will.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Are you planning on hiding from us now?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That was not the plan, no.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Abby and I... we'd like to see the kids more. What would you say to Thanksgiving?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We'll see you in November.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay. Ben hangs up the receiver as the other kids come out of t gas station convenience store, carrying some fruit.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You hungry? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RELLIAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Ben hands him an apple and they all walk back to Steve. BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A yellow school bus, passing through farm land in Western Oregon, kicks up dust on a dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vespyr and Kielyr run through a large vegetable garden - raised-beds, lines of lettuce, broccoli, cabbage, kale, a Swiss chard are neatly organized in perfectly-spaced rows They run toward Steve - propped up and without wheels - sitting at the edge of the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of Steve has been completely gutted and transformed into a gigantic chicken coop. Dozens of CHICK cluck when Vespyr and Kielyr enter the bus.

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. The girls pour feed into 12-gallon, galvanized steel poul feeders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vespyr and Kielyr walk into the kitchen of a funky house: furniture appears second hand, the walls are all painted different colors, kid's drawings cover the walls. The place is also cluttered with string and tape, hanging found objects creating bizarre sculptures; bicycles, skateboards, musical instruments, and toys cover every surface.

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: We have to buy more feed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KIELYR
dialogues.text: We only have enough for another two days or so. The twins pass Ben and sit at the breakfast room table. T fix themselves bowls of cereal and immediately fall into reading their books.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You both finish the "Madame Bovary" book report?

dialogues.speaker: KIELYR
dialogues.text: Plus Mr. Grant let us do "The Tin Drum" for extra credit.

dialogues.speaker: VESPYR
dialogues.text: That shit is intense. Now Rell, Zaja, and Nai come in, each carrying a basket o freshly picked vegetables: broccoli, mesclun, romaine lettuce, peas, green beans, and squash.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Bus is here in 10. They put the vegetable baskets on the counter - next to t their school backpacks - and sit down to eat breakfast. T also all read or work on their homework. Ben takes the lunch he’s made for his five kids - peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and apples - and places them paper bags. He sets them out on the counter, each bag identified with their name. He stares at the lunch bags for a moment. Then he breaks some broccoli into stalks and places a pie in each bag. Ben sits down next to his kids, watching them eat. Without looking up from his book, Rellian pours cereal an milk into a bowl and passes it over to his dad. Ben smiles. And then - for an extended period of time - they all just continue to eat in silence. THE END.
